description.narrative: Partners and key stakeholders in Thailand have increased knowledge, capacity and opportunities to effectively advocate for the protection and realization of child rights.

mailing-address.narrative: 19 Phra Athit Road Banglumpoo Pranakorn Bangkok 10200

sector.narrative: Building research capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Capacity and skills development for social behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation

description.narrative: Other General Services support to civil society

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Partners and key stakeholders in Thailand have increased knowledge, capacity and opportunities to effectively advocate for the protection and realization of child rights.

description.narrative: The power of people has been the centerpiece of advocacy, engagement and campaign efforts during 2019 for UNICEF Thailand. These included both adults and young people, with the aim of creating a cohort of supporters who take action to bring about change for children, while growing their affinity to UNICEF. As a pilot country for the Global Supporter Engagement Strategy (SES) initiative, this has been a year of introducing and testing the approach through several flagship initiatives throughout the year. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:24/01/2020

title.narrative: Number of cross-sectoral public advocacy initiatives with partners to promote positive perception on the rights of children in Thai society with UNICEF involved
Number of new partnerships established with CSO, government, private sector, and other networks
Number of people who take action in support of UNICEF (petitions, volunteering, etc.)
Number of high-profile individuals (including GWAs, influencers, political/community/religious leaders, etc.) who publicly support/amplify UNICEF advocacy messages and initiatives
Number of registered non-financial supporters (digital advocates, youth and adult volunteers) with plan of touchpoints and calls to action developed and implemented

baseline.value: 20,000 registered non-financial supporters, and 2,600 actively participating (digital advocates youth and adults- and volunteers)

target.value: 2020:22,000¿registered non-financial supporters, and 2,860 actively participating (digital advocates – youth and adults – and volunteers)

title.narrative: Number of initiatives that engage civil society partners and/or coalitions to advocate together with UNICEF for children
Generation and use of social, behavioural and communication data and evidence meets quality standards for informing and monitoring C4D strategies in Country Programme priorities

Flagship office-wide advocacy initiative to enable long-term and impactful engagement (Shared KPIs across sectors, supporter-centric targets identified, testing plan put in place, lessons learned documented).
Digital engagement strategy in place and digital marketing expertise enlisted to complement and strengthen existing resources.
Segmentation study of existing audience base based on sample audience using quant & qual research, with an ongoing structure to collect the survey information from newly registered supporters.
